short_summary: The Department of Foreign Affairs seeks to renovate the staff quarters in The Hague.
description: The renovation will include upgrading elements of the building, upgrading the living spaces, addressing all health and safety issues, and redecorating the space.
tags: Estimated Start Date: 1 month after contract award
Estimated End Date: 7 months after contract award
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### [Summary]
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department of) is issuing an Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) to prequalify contractors for the Renovation of Residential Building for the Embassy of Canada to the Netherlands.

#### Table of Contents
- [Eligibility and Participation](#eligibility-participation)
- [Scope of Work](#scope-of-work)
- [Solicitation Requirements](#solicitation-requirements)
- [Prequalification and Selection](#prequalification-and-selection)
- [Contract Award and Performance](#contract-award-and-performance)
- [Contact Information](#contact-information)

#### Eligibility and Participation
Eligible contractors must demonstrate the necessary knowledge, skills, and experience in similar projects to participate in the subsequent Request for Tender (RFP) phase.

#### Scope of Work
The estimated quantity of the commodity is one (1) complete renovation of the staff quarters at the Embassy of Canada to the Netherlands. The scope includes:

- Upgrading elements of the building
- Upgrading living spaces
- Addressing health and safety issues
- Redecorating the space

#### Solicitation Requirements
The procurement will be carried out in two stages:

1.  Request for Qualification (RQ): Assess prequalification of contractors possessing the necessary knowledge, skills, and experience in similar projects.
2.  Request for Proposal (RFP): Select contractors to participate in the subsequent tender phase after successful prequalification.

#### Prequalification and Selection
The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) aims to prequalify contractors that meet the required standards. Subsequently, selected contractors will be invited to participate in the RFP phase.

#### Contract Award and Performance
The contractor(s) selected through the RFP phase will be awarded a contract for the duration of six (6) months, including time for delivery of the completed works.

#### Contact Information
Contractors interested in participating in the prequalification process must submit their qualifications at [realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca](mailto:realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca) by [2023-01-23T14:00:00](tel:2023-01-23T14:00:00).
Contact: Di Virgilio, Tanya, Phone: 343-573-0472, Email: [realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca](mailto:realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca)
